items.question: What is this site for?
items.answer: This site provides practical, non-judgmental guidance for supporting colleagues, friends, and family during Ramadan — especially in workplace settings. It's designed to be easy to share, print, and reference when you're not sure what to say or do.

items.question: Where does this information come from?
items.answer: This guide is built from reputable workplace resources (ACAS, CIPD, Equality and Human Rights Commission), health guidance (NHS, British Islamic Medical Association), and research on sleep and routine changes during Ramadan. See our Sources page for a complete list of references.

items.question: Is this medical or legal advice?
items.answer: No. This guide is for informational purposes only and is not a substitute for professional medical, legal, or religious guidance. If you have health concerns, legal questions, or religious questions, please consult appropriate professionals.

items.question: Can I share or print this?
items.answer: Yes! The main guide is free to use, share, and print for personal and workplace purposes. You can print the one-pager, share links, or reference this content in your own materials (with attribution). See our Terms of Use for details.

items.question: How often is this updated?
items.answer: We aim to update this guide annually before Ramadan. The last updated date is shown on the Sources page. If you spot an issue or want to suggest an improvement, please contact us.

items.question: Who made this?
items.answer: This guide was created to make Ramadan support feel simple and respectful in workplaces. It prioritizes practical guidance and privacy — never assuming who is or isn't fasting. See our About page for more information.
